@tgravescs 
I add a new commit that move waitBackendReady from DAGScheduler.submitStage to TaskSchedulerImpl.submitTasks, for 2 reasons
- Optimize performance, some works (creating TaskSet, building task preferred locality...)  is irrelevant with executor, that can be done before waiting backend ready.
- Clear responsibility, it seems waiting backend ready is responsibility of TaskScheduler, not DAGScheduler.
Weird, I can't reproduce the test failure locally, and the failed test case seems completely unrelated to the change...

Jenkins, test this please. @sebastienrainville thanks! Did you test this by chance on your cluster? Unfortunately our test coverage is not good here.

In a related note, I made a JIRA to do a broader clean-up of this function. Overall it's more complicated than it needs to be as is. But we should definitely still merge this fix.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-2269

@vanzin I was only referring to how the UI URL is passed around. I have used the longer way of passing it around using command line arguments whereas the other change uses spark conf by simply setting it as another property.
Uploaded a new patch that adds a general executor->driver heartbeat.  With the patch, observed jobs running fine on a pseudo-distributed yarn cluster.

To be honest, my scar from the incident (deprecating Scala 2.10 support before Scala 2.11 was even released) hasn't fully recovered. Do we gain anything by moving onto this logging API? There is a tiny teeny performance boost, but I don't think we log any hot code path in spark-core.
Thanks. Merging this in master & branch-1.0.
Ok merging this. Thanks.
I'm going to merge this first since the test is most likely a different problem.
